key_features: Chained string validators: z.string().email(), z.string().url(), z.string().uuid()
z.string().ip() for IP validation (both v4 and v6)
z.string().ip({ version: 'v4' }) for specific IP version
required_error and invalid_type_error in schema options
message parameter in refinement/check options (e.g., .min(3, { message: '...' }))
z.record(valueSchema) with single argument (keys default to string)
errorMap callback for custom error maps
notes: String validators are CHAINED: z.string().email(), NOT z.email()
z.string().ip() exists — do NOT use z.ipv4() or z.ipv6() (those are v4)
Error customization uses required_error and invalid_type_error in schema config
Refinement error uses { message: '...' }, NOT { error: '...' }
z.record(z.string()) with single arg is valid — keys default to string
.deepPartial() is available for making nested objects deeply optional
errorMap is available for custom error mapping
